summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and p-xylene are both identified as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that are commonly emitted into the environment from industrial activities and are included in the priority substances list due to their hazardous properties. They are part of the BTEX group, which is significant in discussions about environmental pollution and bioremediation strategies. However, the context does not elaborate on their specific interactions or comparative significance beyond their classification as pollutants.
